S100CI:address.S100CI:deliveryPoint: International Hydrographic Organization, 4 quai Antoine 1er, B.P. 445

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Administrative Division
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Administrative division is a generic term for an administrative region within a country at a level below that of the sovereign state.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Application profile
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: name of an application profile that can be used with the online resource (ISO 19115)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: In ballast
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether the vessel is in ballast.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call name of a station, e.g. radio station, radar station, pilot.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This is the name used when calling a radio station by radio i.e. "Singapore Pilots".

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Call sign
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The designated call-sign of a radio station.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Cardinal direction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Principal and intermediate compass points.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: N
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: north

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NNE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: northnortheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: northeast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ENE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: eastnortheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: E
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: east

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ESE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: eastsoutheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southeast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SSE
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southsoutheast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: S
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: south

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SSW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southsouthwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: southwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: WSW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: westsouthwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: W
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: west

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: WNW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: westnorthwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: northwest

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NNW
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: northnorthwest

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of authority
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The type of person, government agency or organisation granted powers of managing or controlling access to and/or activity in an area

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The agency or establishment for collecting duties, tolls. (Merriam-Websters online Dictionary 23rd February 2006, amended).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: border control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The administration to prevent or detect and prosecute violations of rules and regulations at international boundaries (adapted from Merriam-Websters online Dictionary 23rd February 2006).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The department of government, or civil force, charged with maintaining public order. (Adapted from OED)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Person or corporation, owners of, or entrusted with or invested with the power of managing a port. May be called a Harbour Board, Port Trust, Port Commission, Harbour Commission, Marine Department (NP 100 8th Edition 14 Oct 2004)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: immigration
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority controlling people entering a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: health
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for checking the validity of the health declaration of a vessel and for declaring free pratique.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: coast guard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Organisation keeping watch on shipping and coastal waters according to governmental law; normally the authority with responsibility for search and rescue.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: agricultural
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The authority with responsibility for preventing infection of the agriculture of a country and for the protection of the agricultural interests of a country.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: military
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A military authority which provides control of access to or approval for transit through designated areas or airspace.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: private company
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A private or publicly owned company or commercial enterprise which exercises control of facilities, for example a calibration area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: maritime police
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A governmental or military force with jurisdiction in territorial waters. Examples could include Gendarmerie Maritime, Carabinierie, and Guardia Civil.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: environmental
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the protection of the environment.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fishery
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An authority with responsibility for the control of fisheries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: finance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an authority with responsibility for the control and movement of money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: maritime
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A national or regional authority charged with administration of maritime affairs.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of the different types of cargo that a ship may be carrying.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bulk
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Normally dry cargo which is transported to and from the vessel on conveyors or grabs

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: container
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: One of a number of standard sized cargo carrying units, secured using standard corner attachments and bars

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: general
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Break bulk cargo normally loaded by crane

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: liquid
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Any cargo loaded by pipeline

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: passenger
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A fee paying traveller

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: livestock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Live animals carried in bulk

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dangerous or hazardous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Dangerous or hazardous cargo as described by the IMO International Maritime Dangerous Goods code

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: heavy lift
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Indivisible heavy items of weight generally over 100 tons, and width or height greater than 100 meters.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ballast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Material carried by a ship to ensure its stability.
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: The material is generally a heavy material such as gravel, sand, iron, or water.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of communication preference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of frequencies, VHF channels, telephone numbers, or other means of communication based on preference.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: preferred calling
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the first choice channel or frequency to be used when calling a radio station

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: alternate calling
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a channel or frequency to be used for calling a radio station when the preferred channel or frequency is busy or is suffering from interference

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: preferred working
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the first choice channel or frequency to be used when working with a radio station

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: alternate working
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a channel or frequency to be used for working with a radio station when the preferred working channel or frequency is busy or is suffering from interference

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of concentration of shipping hazard area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of shipping hazards due to traffic volume or density.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: concentration of merchant shipping
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Concentration of vessels whose primary purpose is to engage in commerce, including ferries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: concentration of recreational vessels
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Concentration of powered or sailing vessels principally engaged in recreation, leisure, or sporting competition.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: concentration of fishing vessels
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Concentration of vessels whose primary purpose is to hunt, trap or process fish. The concentration could be on the fishing ground, in transit or in the approaches to home bases or fish markets.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: concentration of military vessels
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Concentration of vessels principally engaged in military activities. This includes activities based on mandate of international organisations (e.g. UN). The concentration is in areas others than military exercise areas.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of dangerous or hazardous cargo
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of dangerous goods or hazardous materials based on the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 1: substances and articles which have a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 2: substances and articles which have a projection hazard but not a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 3: substances and articles which have a fire hazard and either a minor blast hazard or a minor projection hazard or both, but not a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.4
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 4: substances and articles which present no significant hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.5
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 5: very insensitive substances which have a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 1 Div. 1.6
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Explosives, Division 6: extremely insensitive articles which do not have a mass explosion hazard

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, flammable gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, non-flammable, non-toxic gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 2 Div. 2.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gases, toxic gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: flammable liquids

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: flammable solids, self-reactive substances and desensitized explosives

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: substances liable to spontaneous combustion

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 4 Div. 4.3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: substances which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: oxidizing substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 5 Div. 5.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: organic peroxides

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6 Div. 6.1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: toxic substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 6 Div. 6.2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: infectious substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 7
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Radioactive material

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 8
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Corrosive substances

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMDG Code Class 9
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Miscellaneous dangerous substances and articles

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Harmful Substances in packaged form
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Harmful substances are those substances which are identified as marine pollutants in the International Maritime Dangerous Goods Code (IMDG Code). Packaged form is defined as the forms of containment specified for harmful substances in the IMDG Code. (MARPOL (73/78) Annex III)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of maritime broadcast
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of maritime broadcast based on the nature of information conveyed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigational warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: message containing urgent information relevant to safe navigation broadcast to ships in accordance with the provisions of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974, as

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: meteorological warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of adverse weather conditions

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ice report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: report of the ice situation and restrictions to shipping

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SAR information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message with information about an ongoing SAR operation

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pirate attack warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of possible attack by pirates

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: meteorological forecast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message containing meteorological forecast

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot service message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about pilot service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: AIS information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about AIS information

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: LORAN message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about the LORAN service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SATNAV message
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast message about Satellite Navigation service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gale warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of winds of Beaufort force 8 or 9

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: storm warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of winds of Beaufort force 10 or over

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tropical revolving storm warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of hurricanes in the North Atlantic and eastern North Pacific, typhoons in the Western Pacific, cyclones in the Indian Ocean and cyclones of similar nature in other regions

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVAREA warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational warning or in-force bulletin promulgated as part of a numbered series by a NAVAREA coordinator (Maritime Safety Information Manual 2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: coastal warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational warning promulgated as part of a numbered series by a National coordinator (Maritime Safety Information Manual 2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: local warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning which covers inshore waters, often within the limits of jurisdiction of a harbour or port authority (Maritime Safety Information Manual 2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: low water level warning/negative tidal surge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of actual or expected low water level

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: icing warning
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: warning of accretion of ice on ships

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tsunami broadcast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcasts about tsunamis, including watches, advisories, and other types of messages relating to tsunamis or potential tsunamis

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of military practice area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of area by military use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: torpedo exercise area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which exercises are carried out with torpedoes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: submarine exercise area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which submarine exercises are carried out.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: firing danger area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: areas for bombing and missile exercises.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mine-laying practice area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area within which mine laying exercises are carried out.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: small arms firing range
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area for shooting pistols, rifles and machine guns etc. at a target.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of navigation line
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of route guidance given to vessels

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: clearing line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a straight line that marks the boundary between a safe and a dangerous area or that passes clear of a navigational danger.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: transit line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a line passing through one or more fixed marks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leading line bearing a recommended track
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a line passing through one or more clearly defined objects, along the path of which a vessel can approach safely up to a certain distance off.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of pilot
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of pilots and pilot services by type of waterway where piloting services are provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pilot licenced to conduct vessels during approach from sea to a specified place which may be a handover place, an anchorage or alongside.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: deep sea
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pilot licenced to conduct vessels over extensive sea areas.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: harbour
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pilot who is licenced to conduct vessels from a specified place, such as a handover area or anchorage into a harbour.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bar
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pilot licensed to conduct vessels over a bar to or from a handover with a river pilot (for example as used in USA).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: river
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pilot licensed to conduct vessels from and to specified places, along the course of a river (for example as used in Rio Amazonas and Rio de La Plata).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: channel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pilot licensed to conduct vessels from and to specified places, along the course of a channel. (for example as used in Rio Amazonas and Rio de La Plata).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: lake
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Pilot licensed to conduct vessels from and to specified places on a great lake. (for example as used in the Lago de Maracaibo in Venezuela.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: boarding by pilot-cruising vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pilot boards from a cruising vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: boarding by helicopter
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pilot boards by helicopter which comes out from the shore.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot comes out from shore
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pilot boards from a vessel which comes out from the shore on request.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of preference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The selection of a first choice compared to other options.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: primary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The preferred first choice used in normal conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: alternate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The preferred choice in extraordinary conditions.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of radio methods
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Categories of radiocommunications based on frequency band and radio traffic method.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Frequency (LF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 kHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3 000kHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Very High Frequency (VHF) voice traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 MHz used for voice traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency Narrow Band Direct Printing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: High Frequency Narrow Band Direct Printing

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVTEX
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Narrow-band direct-printing telegraphy system for transmission of maritime safety information. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3412)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SafetyNET
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: SafetyNET is an international automatic direct-printing satellite-based service for the promulgation of navigational and meteorological warnings, meteorological forecasts and other urgent safety-related messages - maritime safety information (MSI) - to ships. (International SafetyNET Manual, 2003 Edition, IMO Publication Number IA908E)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NBDP Telegraphy (Narrow Band Direct Printing Telegraphy)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A communications system consisting of teletypewriters connected to a telephonic network to send and receive Narrow Band Direct Printing. (Adapted American Heritage Dictionary)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: facsimile
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A method or device for transmitting documents, drawings, photographs, or the like, by means of radio or telephone for exact reproduction elsewhere.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: NAVIP
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A Russian system transmitting navigational information, send by radio and containing information relevant to coastal waters of foreign countries and high seas. (Central Marine Research and Design Institute, St.-Petersburg, Russia)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Frequency (LF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 kHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3000kHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Very High Frequency (VHF) digital traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 MHz used for digital traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Low Frequency (LF) telegraph traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 kHz used for telegraph traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) telegraph traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3 000kHz used for telegraph traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) telegraph traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for telegraph traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Medium Frequency (MF) Digital Selective Call traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 300 and 3000kHz used for Digital Selective Call traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: High Frequency (HF) Digital Selective Call traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 3 and 30 MHz used for Digital Selective Call traffic

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Very High Frequency (VHF) Digital Selective Call traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Frequency in a frequency range between 30 and 300 MHz used for Digital Selective Call traffic

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of relationship
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses constraints or requirements on vessel actions or activities in relation to a geographic feature, facility, or service

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway or service is forbidden

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway or service is not recommended

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: permitted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is permitted but not required

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is recommended

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is required

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not required
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: use of facility, waterway, or service is not required

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of restricted area
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The official legal status of each kind of restricted area defines the kind of restriction(s), e.g., the restriction for a 'game preserve' may be 'entering prohibited', the restriction for an 'anchoring prohibition area' is 'anchoring prohibited'.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Permitted values for status should be reviewed, some are probably irrelevant to MPAs without wrecks, obstructions, or any navigation aids

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: offshore safety zone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the area around an offshore installation within which vessels are prohibited from entering without permission special regulations protect installations within a safety zone and vessels of all nationalities are required to respect the zone.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: nature reserve
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tract of land managed so as to preserve it's flora, fauna, physical features, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bird sanctuary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a place where birds are bred and protected.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: game reserve
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a place where wild animals or birds hunted for sport or food are kept undisturbed for private use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: seal sanctuary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a place where seals are protected.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: degaussing range
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area, usually about two cables diameter, within which ships' magnetic fields may be measured sensing instruments and cables are installed on the sea bed in the range and there are cables leading from the range to a control position ashore.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: military area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area controlled by the military in which restrictions may apply.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: historic wreck area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area around certain wrecks of historical importance to protect the wrecks from unauthorized interference by diving, salvage or deposition (including anchoring).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigational aid safety zone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area around a navigational aid which vessels are prohibited from entering.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: minefield
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area laid and maintained with explosive mines for defence or practice purposes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: waiting area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area reserved for vessels waiting to enter a harbour.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: research area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area where marine research takes place.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fish sanctuary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a place where fish are protected.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ecological reserve
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tract of land managed so as to preserve the relation of plants and living creatures to each other and to their surroundings.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: swinging area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area where vessels turn.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: environmentally sensitive sea area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A generic term which may be used to describe a wide range of areas, considered sensitive for a variety of environmental reasons.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: particularly sensitive sea area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area that needs special protection through action by IMO because of its significance for regional ecological, socio-economic or scientific reasons and because it may be vulnerable to damage by international shipping activities.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: disengagement area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area near a fairway where vessels can go to clear the way or make an about turn and possibly return to a waiting area when nautical conditions impose it.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: port security area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: Capitalization in registry is inconsistent and definition is N/A

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: coral sanctuary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A place where coral is protected.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recreation area
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area within which recreational activities regularly take place and therefore vessel movement may be restricted.
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Adapted from S-57 Edition 3.1, Appendix A – Chapter 2, Page 2.76, November 2000).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of routeing measure
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of routeing measures by type.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: archipelagic sea lane
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Sea lanes designated by an archipelagic State for the passage of ships and aircraft.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: deep water route
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A route within defined limits which has been accurately surveyed for clearance of sea bottom and submerged obstacles as indicated on the chart.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fairway system
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: That part of a river, harbour and so on, where the main navigable channel for vessels of larger size lies. It is also the usual course followed by vessels entering or leaving harbours, called “ship channel”.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recommended route
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A navigation line, range system, or a recommended track, lane, or route.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: traffic separation scheme
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A scheme which aims to reduce the risk of collision in congested and/or converging areas by separating traffic moving in opposite, or nearly opposite, directions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: two-way route
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A route within defined limits inside which two way traffic is established, aimed at providing safe passage of ships through waters where navigation is difficult or dangerous.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of ship report
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of ship reports based on IMO standard report formats.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Through Resolution A.851(20), the IMO encourages authorities to require standard formats and procedures for ship reporting specified at ID 1 to 7 above but recognises that some authorities require amended formats and these cases are covered by ID 8 "any other report". (Appendix to IMO Resolution A.851(20) GENERAL PRINCIPLES FOR SHIP REPORTING SYSTEMS AND SHIP REPORTING REQUIREMENTS, INCLUDING GUIDELINES FOR REPORTING INCIDENTS INVOLVING DANGEROUS GOODS, HARMFUL SUBSTANCES AND/OR MARINE POLLUTANTS.)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: sailing plan
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: before or as near as possible to the time of departure from a port within a system or when entering the area covered by a system [for instance A, B, J, X etc.)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: position report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: when necessary to ensure effective operation of the system

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: deviation report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: when the ship’s position varies significantly from the position that would have been predicted from previous reports, when changing the reported route, or as decided by the master

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: final report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: on arrival at the destination or on leaving the area covered by the system

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dangerous goods report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: when an incident takes place involving the loss or likely loss overboard of packaged dangerous goods, including those in freight containers, portable tanks, road and rail vehicles and shipborne barges, into the sea

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: harmful substances report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: when an incident takes place involving the discharge or probable discharge of oil (Annex I of MARPOL 73/78) or noxious liquid substances in bulk (Annex II of MARPOL 73/78)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: marine pollutants report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: in the case of the loss or likely loss overboard of harmful substances in packaged form, including those in freight containers, portable tanks, road and rail vehicles and shipborne barges identified in the International Maritime Goods Code as marine pollutants (Annex III of MARPOL 73/78).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: any other report
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: any other report should be made in accordance with the system procedures as notified in accordance with paragraph 9 of the general principles

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of signal station, traffic
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of station based on the traffic service provided

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: port control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station for the control of vessels within a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: port entry and departure
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station for the control of vessels entering or leaving a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: International Port Traffic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station displaying International Port Traffic signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: berthing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station for the control of vessels when berthing.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station for the control of vessels entering or leaving a dock.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: lock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station for the control of vessels entering or leaving a lock.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: flood barrage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station for the control of vessels wishing to pass through a flood control barrage.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bridge passage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station for the control of vessels wishing to pass under a bridge.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dredging
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal station indicating when dredging is in progress.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: traffic control light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: visual signal lights placed in a waterway to indicate to shipping the movements authorised at the time at which they are shown.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: oncoming traffic indication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: indicates the oncoming traffic on an inland waterway.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of signal station, warning
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of station based on the warning service provided

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: danger
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message warning of the presence of a danger to navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: maritime obstruction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message warning of the presence of a maritime obstruction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cable
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message warning of the presence of a cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: military practice
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message warning of activity in a military practice area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: distress
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a station that may receive or transmit distress signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: weather
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a visual signal displayed to indicate a weather forecast.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: storm
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message conveying information about storm conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ice
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message conveying information about ice conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: time
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an accurate signal marking a specified time or time interval. It is used primarily for determining errors of timepieces. Such signals are usually sent from an observatory by radio or telegraph, but visual signals are used at some ports.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tide
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message conveying information on tidal conditions in the area in question.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tidal stream
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message conveying information on condition of tidal currents in the area in question.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tide gauge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a device for measuring the height of tide. A graduated staff in a sheltered area where visual observations can be made or it may consist of an elaborate recording instrument making a continuous graphic record of tide height against time. Such an instrument is usually actuated by a float in a pipe communicating with the sea through a small hole which filters out shorter waves.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tide scale
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a visual scale which directly shows the height of the water above chart datum or a local datum.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diving
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal or message warning of diving activity

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: water level gauge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a device for measuring and conveying information about the water level (non-tidal) in the area in question.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: vertical clearance indication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An indication of the vertical clearance of a bridge, overhead cable, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: high water mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An indication of the official high water level.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: depth indication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An indication of the local depth.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of Traffic Separation Scheme
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: International classification of traffic separation scheme

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IMO - Adopted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A defined Traffic Separation Scheme that has been adopted as an IMO routing measure.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not IMO - adopted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a defined Traffic Separation Scheme that has not been adopted as an IMO routing measure.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of temporal variation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An assessment of the likelihood of change over time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Extreme Event
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Indication of the possible impact of a significant event (for example hurricane, earthquake, volcanic eruption, landslide, etc), which is considered likely to have changed the seafloor or landscape significantly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Likely to Change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Continuous or frequent change to non-bathymetric features (for example river siltation, glacier creep/recession, sand dunes, buoys, marine farms, etc.).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Unlikely to Change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Significant change to the seafloor is not expected.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of completeness of textual information in relation to the source.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: abstract or summary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A statement summarizing the important points of a text

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: extract
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An excerpt or excerpts from a text

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: full text
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The whole text

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of vessel registry
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The locality of vessel registration or enrolment relative to the nationality of a port, territorial sea, administrative area, exclusive zone or other location.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: domestic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under the same national flag as the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: foreign
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The vessel is registered or enrolled under a national flag different from the port, harbour, territorial sea, exclusive economic zone, or other administrative area in which the object that possesses this attribute applies or is located.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of vessel traffic service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of vessel traffic services based on the nature of the control or services provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Information Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service to ensure that essential information becomes available in time for on-board navigational decision-making

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Traffic Organisation Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service to assist on-board navigational decision-making and to monitor its effects

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Navigational Assistance Service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A service to prevent the development of dangerous maritime traffic situations and to provide for the safe and efficient movement of vessel traffic within the VTS area

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: City name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a town or city.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Communication channel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A channel number assigned to a specific radio frequency, frequencies or frequency band.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the specific VHF-Channel. The attribute 'communication channel' encodes the various VHF-channels used for communication.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Comparison Operator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Numerical comparison
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The definition of COMPOP provides the relation between the value given in the model and the real ship's value.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: greater than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left value is greater than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: greater than or equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is greater than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: less than
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: less than or equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The value of the left expression is less than or equal to that of the right.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are equivalent.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not equal to
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The two values are not equivalent.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Condition
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The various conditions of buildings and other constructions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: under construction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a structure that is in the process of being built.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: under reclamation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area of the sea that is being reclaimed as land, usually by the dumping of earth and other material.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: planned construction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area where a future construction is planned.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Contact instructions
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Instructions provided on how to contact a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Country Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a nation.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day of Week
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Days of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Sunday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The first day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Monday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The second day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Tuesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The third day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Wednesday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The fourth day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Thursday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The fifth day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Friday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The sixth day of the week.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Saturday
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The seventh day of the week.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Day of week is range
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if the days of the week identified define a range or not.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date end
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The latest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is to be used to indicate the removal or cancellation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date end' (PEREND).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The earliest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is to be used to indicate the deployment or implementation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date start' (PERSTA).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Delivery point
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Details of where post can be delivered such as the apartment, name and/or number of a street, building or PO Box.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Destination
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The place or general direction to which a vessel is going or directed.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: In addition to a placename of a port, harbour area or terminal, the place could include generalities such as “The north-west”, or “upriver”.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Direction uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a bearing.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Display name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement expressing if a feature name is to be displayed in certain system display settings or not

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Distance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A numeric measure of the spatial separation between two locations.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The value may be estimated or approximate, or accurate to a known uncertainty factor. Product specifications should indicate the uncertainty factor, if any, in metadata or an uncertainty co-attribute.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Dynamic resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether a vessel must use a shore-based or other resource to obtain up-to-date information.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: static
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The information is static, or a source of up-to-date information is unavailable or unknown.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mandatory external dynamic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An external source of up-to-date information is available and interaction with it to obtain up-to-date information is required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: optional external dynamic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An external source of up-to-date information is available but interaction with it to obtain up-to-date information is not required.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: onboard dynamic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Up-to-date information may be computed using only onboard resources.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Locator
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The string encodes the location of a fragment of text or other information in a support file.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Product specifications must state how the association between a FILLOC and a support file is made. For example, the associated support file may be identified as the file named by a TXTDSC attribute bound to the same TXTCON attribute. Product specifications are also expected to describe the meaning of the pointer for a data product and state how the supporting files must be structured (bookmarked, tagged, etc.). For example, the pointer may be an XML ID, HTML ID, line number, bookmark in a PDF file, a "key" in a resources file, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: File Reference
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The string encodes the file name of an external text file that contains the text in English

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date of an event.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Flip bearing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The bearing at which text is re-located to the opposite side of a feature when screen display is oriented away from true north.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Receives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station receiver frequency expressed in kHz to one decimal place.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: 4379.1 kHz becomes 043791; 13162.8 kHz becomes 131628

S100FC:uom.S100Base:name: kHz
S100FC:uom.S100Base:definition: Kilohertz to 1 decimal place converted to an integer

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency Shore Station Transmits
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shore station transmitter frequency expressed in kHz to one decimal place.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Examples: 4379.1 kHz becomes 043791; 13162.8 kHz becomes 131628

S100FC:uom.S100Base:name: kHz
S100FC:uom.S100Base:definition: Kilohertz to 1 decimal place converted to an integer

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Headline
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Words set at the head of a passage or page to introduce or categorize

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal distance uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the horizontal accuracy of horizontal clearances and distances.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character must not be encoded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: IMO format for reporting
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether a report must be in an IMO standard format

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: ISPS level
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of ISPS security levels according to the ISPS Code.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ISPS Level 1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The level for which minimum appropriate protective security measures shall be maintained at all times.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ISPS Level 2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The level for which appropriate additional protective security measures shall be maintained for a period of time as a result of heightened risk of a security incident.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ISPS Level 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The level for which further specific protective security measures shall be maintained for a limited period of time when a security incident is probable or imminent, although it may not be possible to identify the specific target.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Jurisdiction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The jurisdiction applicable to an administrative area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: international
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: involving more than one country covering more than one national area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: national
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area administered or controlled by a single nation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: national sub-division
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area smaller than the nation in which it lies.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Language
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The language is encoded by a character code following ISO 639-3

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Logical Connectives
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Expresses whether all the constraints described by its co-attributes must be satisfied, or only one such constraint need be satisfied.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is intended to be used with co-attributes that encode limits on vessel dimensions, type of cargo, and other characteristics. The combination of constraints described by logicalConnective and its co-attributes defines a subset of vessels to which information described by a feature or information type instance applies (or does not apply, is required, recommended, etc.). The relationship between the vessel subset and the information is indicated by an association - see PermissionType and InclusionType). The two listed values of logicalConnective are two of the basic operations of Boolean logic. The third basic operation (not) is not used.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: logical conjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: all the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attribute, are true

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: logical disjunction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: at least one of the conditions described by the other attributes of the object, or sub-attributes of the same complex attributes, is true

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Linkage
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: location (address) for on-line access using a URL/URI address or similar addressing scheme. (Adapted from ISO 19115:2014.)
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Adapted from ISO 19115:2014.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Membership
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: indicates whether a vessel is included or excluded from the regulation / restriction / recommendation / nautical information

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: included
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are included in the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: excluded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Vessels with these characteristics are excluded from the regulation/restriction/recommendation/nautical information

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: MMSI Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI) Code is formed of a series of nine digits which are transmitted over the radio path in order to uniquely identify ship stations, ship earth stations, coast stations, coast earth stations, and group calls. These identities are formed in such a way that the identity or part thereof can be used by telephone and telex subscribers connected to the general telecommunications network principally to call ships automatically.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Nationality
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The nationality of the specific object.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Notice time hours
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The time duration prior to the time the service is needed, when notice must be provided to the service provider.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Notice time text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Text string qualifying the notice time specified in NTCHRS. This may explain the time specification in NTCHRS (e.g., “3 working days” for a NTCHRS value of “72” where NTCTIM is supposed to be "3 working days") or consist of other language qualifying the time, e.g., “On departure from last port” or “On passing reporting line XY”).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The individual name of a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Name of resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Name of the online resource.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Online resource description
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Detailed text description of what the online resource is/does

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Operation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether the minimum or maximum value should be used to describe a condition or in application processing

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: largest value
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The numerically largest value computed from the applicable attributes or sub-attributes

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: smallest value
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The numerically smallest value computed from the applicable attributes or sub-attributes

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a bearing.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture caption
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Short description of the purpose of the image

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Picture information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A set of information to provide credits to picture creator, copyright owner etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pilot movement
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of pilot activity by arrival, departure, or change of pilot. It may also describe the place where the pilot's advice begins, ends, or is transferred to a different pilot.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: embarkation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The place where vessels not being navigated according to a pilot’s instructions pick up a pilot while in transit from sea to a port or constricted waters for future navigation under pilot instructions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: disembarkation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The place where vessels being navigated under a pilot’s instructions in transit from sea to a port or constricted waters drop the pilot and proceed without being subject to pilot instructions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The place where vessels being navigated under a pilot’s instructions drop off the pilot and pick up a different pilot for future navigation under pilot’s instructions.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pilot qualification
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of pilots and pilot services by type of license qualification or type of organization providing services.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: government pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot service carried out by government pilots.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot approved by government
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot service carried out by pilots who are approved by government.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: state pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot that is licensed by the State (USA) and/or their respective pilot association, required for all foreign vessels and all American vessels under registry, bound for a port with compulsory State pilotage. A federal licence is not sufficient to pilot such vessels into the port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: federal pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot who carries a Federal endorsement, offering services to vessels that are not required to obtain compulsory State pilotage. Services are usually contracted for in advance.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: company pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot provided by a commercial company.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: local pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot with local knowledge but who does not hold a qualification as a pilot.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: citizen with sufficient local knowledge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot service carried out by a citizen with sufficient local knowledge.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: citizen with doubtful local knowledge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pilot service carried out by a citizen whose local knowledge is uncertain.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pilot request
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of the pilot request procedure.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pilot vessel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of the pilot vessel. The pilot vessel is a small vessel used by a pilot to go to or from a vessel employing the pilot's services.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Postal code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Known in various countries as a postcode, or ZIP code, the postal code is a series of letters and/or digits that identifies each postal delivery area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Protocol
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: connection protocol to be used. Example: ftp, http get KVP, http POST, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Protocol request
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Request used to access the resource. Structure and content depend on the protocol and standard used by the online resource, such as Web Feature Service standard.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Remote pilot
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Whether remote pilot services are available.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: True: remote pilot is available: Pilotage is available remotely from shore or other location remote from the vessel requiring pilotage. False: remote pilot is not available: Remote pilotage is not available.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Reported date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date that the item was observed, done, or investigated

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Requirements for maintenance of listening watch
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Description of continuous listening watch requirements.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Restriction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The official legal statute of each kind of restricted area.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Defines the kind of restriction(s), e.g., the restriction for 'a game preserve' may be 'entry prohibited', the restriction for an 'anchoring prohibition' is 'anchoring prohibited'. The complete information about the restriction(s), actually held in handbooks or other publications, may be encoded by the attribute 'TXTDSC'. A short explanation may be given by the use of the attribute 'INFORM'.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: anchoring prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which anchoring is not permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: anchoring restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which anchoring is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fishing prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which fishing is not permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fishing restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which fishing is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: trawling prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which trawling is not permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: trawling restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which trawling is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: entry prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which navigation and/or anchoring is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: entry restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which navigation is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dredging prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which dredging is not permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dredging restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which dredging is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diving prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which diving is not permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diving restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which diving is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: no wake
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: mariners must adjust the speed of their vessels to reduce the wave or wash which may cause erosion or disturb moored vessels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: area to be avoided
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an IMO designated area to be avoided, defined as a routeing measure.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: construction prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the erection of permanent or temporary fixed structures or artificial islands is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: discharging prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which discharging or dumping is prohibited

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: discharging restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by an appropriate authority, within which discharging or dumping is restricted in accordance with specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: industrial or mineral exploration/development prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which industrial or mineral exploration and development are prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: industrial or mineral exploration/development restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by an appropriate authority, within which industrial or mineral exploration and development is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: drilling prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which excavating a hole on the sea-bottom with a drill is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: drilling restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by an appropriate authority, within which excavating a hole on the sea-bottom with a drill is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: removal of historical artifacts prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which the removal of historical artifacts is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cargo transhipment (lightering) prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area in which cargo transhipment (lightering) is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dragging prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area in which the dragging of anything along the bottom, e.g. bottom trawling, is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: stopping prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area in which a vessel is prohibited from stopping.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: landing prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area in which landing is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: speed restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which speed is restricted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: overtaking prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which overtaking is generally prohibited

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: overtaking of convoys by convoys prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which overtaking between convoys prohibited

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: passing or overtaking prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which passing or overtaking is generally prohibited

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: berthing prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which vessels, assemblies of floating material or floating establishments may not berth.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: berthing restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which berthing is restricted

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: making fast prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which vessels, assemblies of floating material or floating establishments may not make fast to the bank.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: making fast restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which making fast to the bank is restricted

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: turning prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specified area designated by appropriate authority, within which all turning is generally prohibited

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: restricted fairway depth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which the fairway depth is restricted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: restricted fairway width
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area within which the fairway width is restricted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: use of spuds prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The use of anchoring spuds (telescopic piles) is prohibited

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: swimming prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An area in which swimming is prohibited

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Scale minimum
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum scale at which the object may be used, e.g., for ECDIS presentation.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The modulus of the scale is indicated, that is 1:1 250 000 is encoded as 1250000.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Service access procedure
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of the procedure to access the marine service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Signal frequency
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The frequency of a signal.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Siltation rate
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of the rate at which the depth in an area decreases.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier (publication, document, reference work, instrument, vessel, etc) from which information comes or is acquired.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: type of the source

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: law or regulation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: treaty, convention, or international agreement; law or regulation issued by a national or other authority

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: official publication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: publication not having the force of law, issued by an international organisation or a national or local administration

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mariner report, confirmed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Reported by mariner(s) and confirmed by another source

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mariner report, not confirmed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: reported by mariner(s) but not confirmed

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: industry publications and reports
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: shipping and other industry publication, including graphics, charts and web sites

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: remotely sensed images
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from satellite images

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: photographs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from photographs

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: products issued by HO services
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from products issued by Hydrographic Offices

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: news media
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from news media

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: traffic data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: information obtained from the analysis of traffic data

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Status
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The condition of an object at a given instant in time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: permanent
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: intended to last or function indefinitely.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: occasional
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: acting on special occasions happening irregularly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recommended
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: presented as worthy of confidence, acceptance, use, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not in use
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: no longer used for the purpose intended disused.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: periodic/intermittent
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: recurring at intervals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reserved
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: set apart for some specific use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: temporary
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: meant to last only for a time.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: private
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: not in public ownership or operation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mandatory
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: compulsory enforced.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: extinguished
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: no longer lit

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: illuminated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: lit by floodlights, strip lights, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: historic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: famous in history of historical interest.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: public
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: belonging to, available to, used or shared by, the community as a whole and not restricted to private use.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: synchronized
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: occur at a time, coincide in point of time, be contemporary or simultaneous.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: watched
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: looked at or observed over a period of time especially so as to be aware of any movement or change.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: un-watched
