S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: usually automatic in operation, without any permanently-stationed personnel to superintend it.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: existence doubtful
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object that has been reported but has not been definitely determined to exist.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: buoyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Marked by buoys

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication identifier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An identifier, such as words, numbers, letters, symbols, or any combination of those used to establish a contact to a particular person, organisation or service.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication carrier
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a provider or type of carrier for a telecommunication service. This service may include land line based, shore based or satellite based radio connections.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A non-formatted digital text string

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Thickness of ice capability
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The thickness of ice that the ship can safely transit

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of day end
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Ending time of day, possibly for a period within the day

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Time of day start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Starting time of day, possibly for a period within the day

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Traffic flow
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Direction of vessels passing a reference point.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The direction of travel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: inbound
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: traffic flow in a general direction toward a port or similar destination.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: outbound
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: traffic flow in a general direction away from a port or similar point of origin.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: one-way
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: traffic flow in one general direction only.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: two-way
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: traffic flow in two generally opposite directions.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Transmission content
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Content of transmission
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Other than MSI.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Underkeel allowance fixed
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A fixed allowance given by an authority, which is added to draught in order to maintain a minimum underkeel clearance.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Underkeel allowance variable beam based
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A percentage value, given by an authority, which is applied to ship's beam in order to calculate underkeel allowance.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Underkeel allowance variable draught based
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A percentage value, given by an authority, which is applied to ship's draught in order to calculate underkeel allowance.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels characteristics
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Characteristics of vessels

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: length overall
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The maximum length of the ship (L.O.A.). (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: length at waterline
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The ship's length measured at the waterline (L.W.L.). (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: breadth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The width or beam of the vessel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: draught
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The depth of water necessary to float a vessel fully loaded.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: height
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The height of the highest point of a vessel's structure (e.g. radar aerial, funnel, cranes, masthead) above her waterline. (UKHO NP100/2009)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: displacement tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A measurement of the weight of the vessel, usually used for warships. (Merchant ships are usually measured based on the volume of cargo space; see tonnage). Displacement is expressed either in long tons of 2,240 pounds or metric tonnes of 1,000 kg. Since the two units are very close in size (2,240 pounds = 1,016 kg and 1,000 kg = 2,205 pounds), it is common not to distinguish between them. To preserve secrecy, nations sometimes misstate a warship's displacement. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: displacement tonnage, light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship excluding cargo, fuel, ballast, stores, passengers, and crew, but with water in the boilers to steaming level. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: displacement tonnage, loaded
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The weight of the ship including cargo, passengers, fuel, water, stores, dunnage and such other items necessary for use on a voyage, which brings the vessel down to her load draft. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: deadweight tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The difference between displacement, light and displacement, loaded. A measure of the ship's total carrying capacity. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gross tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The entire internal cubic capacity of the ship expressed in tons of 100 cubic feet to the ton, except certain spaces with are exempted such as: peak and other tanks for water ballast, open forecastle bridge and poop, access of hatchways, certain light and air spaces, domes of skylights, condenser, anchor gear, steering gear, wheel house, galley and cabin for passengers. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Obtained from the gross tonnage by deducting crew and navigating spaces and allowances for propulsion machinery.(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ship_measurements; 24 July 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System (PC/UMS) is based on net tonnage, modified for Panama Canal purposes. PC/UMS is based on a mathematical formula to calculate a vessel's total volume; a PC/UMS net ton is equivalent to 100 cubic feet of capacity. (Adapted from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonnage 4 Oct 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the Suez Canal Net Tonnage (SCNT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate. (Adapted from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonnage 4 Oct 2010)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal gross tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Suez Canal Gross Tonnage (SCGT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels characteristics unit
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: the unit used for vessel characteristics attribute

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: metre
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The metre (or meter) is the base unit of length in the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as the distance travelled by light in vacuum in 1/299,792,458 of a second.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: foot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A foot (plural: feet) is a non-SI unit of length in a number of different systems including English units, Imperial units, and United States customary units. The most commonly used foot today is the international foot. There are three feet in a yard and 12 inches in a foot.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: metric ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The tonne or metric ton (U.S.), often redundantly referred to as a metric tonne, is a unit of mass equal to 1,000 kg (2,205 lb) or approximately the mass of one cubic metre of water at four degrees Celsius. It is sometimes abbreviated as mt in the United States, but this conflicts with other SI symbols. The tonne is not a unit in the International System of Units (SI), but is accepted for use with the SI. In SI units and prefixes, the tonne is a megagram (Mg). The Imperial and US customary units comparable to the tonne are both spelled ton in English, though they differ in mass. Pronunciation of tonne (the word used in the UK) and ton is usually identical, but is not too confusing unless accuracy is important as the tonne and UK long ton differ by only 1.6%.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Long ton (weight ton or imperial ton) is the name for the unit called the "ton" in the avoirdupois or Imperial system of measurements, as used in the United Kingdom and several other Commonwealth countries. It has been mostly replaced by the tonne, and in the United States by the short ton. One long ton is equal to 2,240 pounds (1,016 kg) or 35 cubic feet (0.9911 m3) of salt water with a density of 64 lb/ft³ (1.025 g/ml). It has some limited use in the United States, most commonly in measuring the displacement of ships, and was the unit prescribed for warships by the Washington Naval Treaty—for example battleships were limited to a mass of 35,000 long tons (36,000 t; 39,000 ST).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: short ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The short ton is a unit of weight equal to 2,000 pounds (907.18474 kg). In the United States it is often called simply ton without distinguishing it from the metric ton (tonne, 1,000 kilograms) or the long ton (2,240 pounds / 1,016.0469088 kilograms); rather, the other two are specifically noted. There are, however, some U.S. applications for which unspecified tons normally means long tons (for example, Navy ships) or metric tons (world grain production figures). Both the long and short ton are defined as 20 hundredweights, but a hundredweight is 100 pounds (45.359237 kg) in the U.S. system (short or net hundredweight) and 112 pounds (50.80234544 kg) in the Imperial system (long or gross hundredweight).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gross ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Gross tonnage (GT) is a function of the volume of all ship's enclosed spaces (from keel to funnel) measured to the outside of the hull framing. There is a sliding scale factor. So GT is a kind of capacity-derived index that is used to rank a ship for purposes of determining manning, safety and other statutory requirements and is expressed simply as GT, which is a unitless entity, even though its derivation is tied to the cubic meter unit of volumetric capacity. Tonnage measurements are now governed by an IMO Convention (International Convention on Tonnage Measurement of Ships, 1969 (London-Rules)), which applies to all ships built after July 1982. In accordance with the Convention, the correct term to use now is GT, which is a function of the moulded volume of all enclosed spaces of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: net ton
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Net tonnage (NT) is based on a calculation of the volume of all cargo spaces of the ship. It indicates a vessel’s earning space and is a function of the moulded volume of all cargo spaces of the ship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System net tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System (PC/UMS) is based on net tonnage, modified for Panama Canal purposes. PC/UMS is based on a mathematical formula to calculate a vessel's total volume; a PC/UMS net ton is equivalent to 100 cubic feet of capacity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal Net Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Suez Canal Net Tonnage (SCNT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: none
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Can be used for net and gross tonnages, including Panama Canal/Universal Measurement System net tonnage and The Suez Canal Net Tonnage.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cubic metres
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Cubic metres

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Suez Canal Gross Tonnage
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The Suez Canal Gross Tonnage (SCGT) is derived with a number of modifications from the former net register tonnage of the Moorsom System and was established by the International Commission of Constantinople in its Protocol of 18 December 1873. It is still in use, as amended by the Rules of Navigation of the Suez Canal Authority, and is registered in the Suez Canal Tonnage Certificate.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels characteristics value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The value of a particular characteristic such as a dimension or tonnage of a vessel

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessel performance
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A description of the required handling characteristics of a vessel including hull design, main and auxilliary machinery, cargo handling equipment, navigation equipment and manoeuvring behaviour.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Quality of horizontal measurement
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The degree of reliability attributed to a position

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the position(s) was(were) determined by the operation of making measurements for determining the relative position of points on, above or beneath the earth's surface. Survey implies a regular, controlled survey of any date.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unsurveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: survey data is does not exist or is very poor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: inadequately surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: position data is of a very poor quality.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: approximate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is considered to be less than third-order accuracy, but is generally considered to be within 30.5 metres of its correct geographic location. Also may apply to an object whose position does not remain fixed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: position doubtful
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported but which is considered to be doubtful.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unreliable
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object's position obtained from questionable or unreliable data.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reported (not surveyed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported and its position confirmed by some means other than a formal survey such as an independent report of the same object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reported (not confirmed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported and its position has not been confirmed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: estimated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the most probable position of an object determined from incomplete data or data of questionable accuracy.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: precisely known
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is of a known value, such as the position of an anchor berth or other defined object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: calculated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is computed from data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum display scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The largest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum display scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The smallest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation value
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the object.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pictorial representation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether a pictorial representation of the object is available.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The 'pictorial representation' could be a drawing or a photo. The string encodes the file name of an external graphic file (pixel/vector).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector bearing
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference. Sector bearing specifies the limit of the sector. (Adapted from S-57 Edition 3.1, Appendix A – Chapter 2, Page 2.184, November 2000).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: -The values given to the common limits of adjacent sectors should be identical. - The orientation of the bearing is from seaward to the central feature. This conforms with the method used in “List of Lights” publications. - A generic term such as “to shore” cannot be used; a specific bearing must be encoded. Where a light sector limit is defined as “to the shore”, it should be encoded using a value that ensures that, when the limit is drawn, it will fall entirely on land.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Source date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The production date of the source, e.g., the date of measurement.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date variable
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A day which is not fixed in the Gregorian calendar.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Water level trend
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The tendency of water level to change in a particular direction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: decreasing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Becoming smaller in magnitude.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: increasing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Becoming larger in magnitude.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: steady
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Constant.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Action or activity
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The action or activity of a vessel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigating with a pilot
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Carrying a qualified pilot as part of the vessel navigation team.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: entering port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel into a port

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leaving port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel out of a port.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: berthing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to a wharf or jetty

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: slipping
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from a wharf or jetty.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: anchoring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Attaching a vessel to the seabed by means of an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: weighing anchor
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Detaching a vessel from the seabed by recovering an anchor and cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: transiting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel along a route or through a narrow gap, such as under a bridge or through a lock.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: overtaking
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another traveling broadly in the same direction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reporting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Providing details such as the name, location or intentions of a vessel

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: working cargo
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Loading or unloading cargo

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: landing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Placing crew or passengers on shore

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diving
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Placing a swimmer with an air supply below the sea surface.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fishing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Hunting or catching fish

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: discharging overboard
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Releasing anything into the sea; often ballast water; or spoil from dredging elsewhere.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: passing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Navigating a vessel past another traveling broadly in the opposite direction.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The principal subject matter of regulations, restrictions, recommendations or nautical information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to navigation

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to communication

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: environmental protection
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to environmental protection

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: wildlife protection
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to wildlife protection

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: security
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to security

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: customs
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to customs

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cargo operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to cargo operation

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: refuge
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to a place of safety or refuge

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: health
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to health

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: natural resources or exploitation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: natural resources or exploitation

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: port
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to a port

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: finance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to finance

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: agriculture
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: pertaining to agriculture

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of schedule
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Describes the type of schedule, e.g., opening, closure, etc.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: normal operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service, office, is open, fully manned, and operating normally, or the area is accessible as usual.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: closure
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service, office, or area is closed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unmanned operation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The service is available but not manned.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of vessel
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of vessels by function or use.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: general cargo vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to carry general cargo

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: container carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to carry ISO containers

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tanker
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to carry bulk liquid or gas, including LPG and LNG

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bulk carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to carry bulk solid material

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: passenger vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to carry passengers; often a cruise ship

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: roll-on roll-off
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to allow road vehicles to be driven on and off; often a ferry

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: refrigerated cargo vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to carry refrigerated cargo

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fishing vessel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed to catch or hunt fish

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel which provides a service such as a tug, anchor handler, survey or supply vessel

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: warship
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vessel designed for the conduct of military operations

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: towed or pushed composite unit
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: either a tug and tow, or any combination of a tug providing propulsion to barges or vessels secured ahead or alongside

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tug and tow
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a combination of tug(s) and non-powered tow(s)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: light recreational
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A pleasure boat or watercraft, or an excursion vessel used for short cruises such as whale watching

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: semi-submersible offshore installation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An installation which is designed to float at all times and which is normally anchored in position when deployed in the offshore gas and oil industry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: jack-up exploration or project installation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An exploration or project installation with legs which can be raised and lowered. The legs are raised when the installation is repositioned. When stationary the legs are lowered to the sea floor and the working platform is raised clear of the sea surface

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: livestock carrier
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel designed to carry large quantities of live animals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: sport fishing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A vessel used in fishing for pleasure or competition.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Online function
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Code for function performed by the online resource
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: download
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: information
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online information about the resource.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: offline access
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: order
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online order process for obtaining the resource.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: search
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online search interface for seeking out information about the resource.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: complete metadata
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Complete metadata provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: browse graphic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Browse graphic provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: upload
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online resource upload capability provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: email service
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online email service provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: browsing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online browsing provided.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: file access
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Online file access provided.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunication service
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of methods of communication over a distance by electrical, electronic, or electromagnetic means.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: codeListType=open enumeration; encoding=other: [something]

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: voice
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The transfer or exchange of information by using sounds that are being made by mouth and throat when speaking

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: facsimile
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a system of transmitting and reproducing graphic matter (as printing or still pictures) by means of signals sent over telephone lines

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: SMS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Short Message Service, a form of text messaging communication on phones and mobile phones

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: data
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: facts or information used usually to calculate, analyze, or plan something

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: streamedData
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Streamed data is data that that is constantly received by and presented to an end-user while being delivered by a provider.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: telex
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a system of communication in which messages are sent over long distances by using a telephone system and are printed by using a special machine (called a teletypewriter)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: telegraph
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an apparatus, system, or process for communication at a distance by electric transmission over wire

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: email
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Messages and other data exchanged between individuals using computers in a network.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text justification
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The anchor point of a text string

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: left
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The anchor point is at the start of the text string.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: centred
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The anchor point is at the centre of the text string.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: right
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The anchor point is at the end of the text string.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Text type
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The attribute from which a text string is derived.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: feature name
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: The attribute from which a text string is derived.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal Position Uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a position. The expected input is the maximum of the two-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character shall not be encoded.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The unit of measure is defined in the PUNI subfield of the DSPM record, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 mm.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Bearing information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A bearing is the direction one object is from another object.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Contact address
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Direction or superscription of a letter, package, etc., specifying the name of the place to which it is directed, and optionally a contact person or organisation who should receive it.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Feature name
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute provides the name of an entity, defines the national language of the name, and provides the option to display the name at various system display settings.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Fixed date range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes single fixed period, as the date range between its sub-attributes.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the sub-attributes date start and date end must be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY) and, optionally, 2 digits for the month (MM) (e.g. April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific month and/or day is required/known, the values are replaced with dashes (-).

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Frequency pair
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A pair of frequencies for transmitting and receiving radio signals. The shore station transmits and receives on the frequencies indicated.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Graphic
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Pictorial information such as a photograph, sketch, or other graphic, optionally accompanied by descriptive information about the graphic and the location relative to its subject from which it was made.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Information
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual information about the feature. The information may be provided as a string of text or as a file name of a single external text file that contains the text.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: this complex attribute should be used, for example, to hold the information that is shown on paper charts by cautionary and explanatory notes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Notice time
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Span of time, prior to the time the service is needed, for preparations to be made to fulfil the requirement.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Online resource
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Information about online sources from which a resource or data can be obtained.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The complex attribute describes the access to online resources according to ISO 19115.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Schedule by day of week
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The nature and timings of a daily schedule by days of the week.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Periodic date range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the active period for a seasonal feature (e.g. a buoy), as the dates between its sub-attributes
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The sub-attributes date start and date end should be encoded using 4 digits for the calendar year (YYYY), 2 digits for the month (MM) (for example April = 04) and 2 digits for the day (DD). When no specific year is required (that is, the feature is removed at the same time each year) the following two cases may be considered: - same day each year: ----MMDD - same month each year: ----MM-- This conforms to ISO 8601:2004.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Radiocommunications
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Detailed radiocommunications description with channels, frequencies, preferences and time schedules

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: RxN Code
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A summary of the impact of the most common types of regulation, restriction, recommendation and nautical information on a vessel.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute converts the subject, topic, and effects of regulations, etc., from plain text or natural language into a set of categories.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Source indication
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Information about the source document, publication, or reference from which object data or textual material included or referenced in a dataset are derived

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Survey date range
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: The complex attribute describes the period of the hydrographic survey, as the time between its sub-attributes.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Telecommunications
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A means or channel of communicating at a distance by electrical or electromagnetic means such as telegraphy, telephony, or broadcasting.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Text content
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual material, or a pointer to a resource providing textual material. May be accompanied by basic information about its source and relationship to the source.
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:remarks: textContent is intended to allow text passages from other publications to be included in, or referenced by, instances of feature or information types. Exactly one of sub-attributes onlineResource or information must be completed in one instance of textContent. Product specifications may restrict the use or content of onlineResource for security. For example, a product specification may forbid populating onlineResource. Product specification authors must consider whether applications using the data product may be prevented from accessing off-system resources by security policies.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Time intervals by day of week
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Time intervals by days of the week.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Underkeel allowance
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: A fixed figure, or a figure derived by calculation, which is added to draught in order to maintain the minimum underkeel clearance taking into account the vessel's static and dynamic characteristics, sea state and weather forecast, the reliability of the chart and variance from predicted height of tide or water level.

S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:name: Vessels measurements
S100FC:S100_FC_ComplexAttribute.S100FC:definition: Terms and definitions specifically related to vessels

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Component of
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to the aggregate in a whole-part relationship.
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Definition may need to be discussed with S-101 team and GI registry manager

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Consists of
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a part in a whole-part relationship
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Definition may need to be discussed with S-101 team and GI registry manager

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The applicable RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The applicable regulation, restriction, recommendation or nautical information

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Applies in location
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The location in which the information item applies

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Authority (reference)
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an Authority object

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Authority service hours
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The authority for which service hours are given

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Contact details (reference)
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an Contact Details object

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Control authority
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The controlling organization or authority for a geographically located service

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Controlled service
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The service controlled by an organisation or authority

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Defined for
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific spatial type(s).

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Defines
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an information type providing spatial quality information.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Identifies
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific feature(s).

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Information provided for
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific feature(s) for which further information is required.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Is applicable to
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The object or class of objects to which the regulation, restriction, recommendation, or nautical information applies

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Location service hours
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The location for which service hours are given

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The information
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Information related to an organisation

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The organisation
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The organisation to which information relates

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Partial working day
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The work hours for a non-standard workday

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Permission
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The permissions for a location

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Must be filed by
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The class (generally, qualifying vessels) which must file the report

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Positions
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to a specific cartographically positioned location for text.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Provides information
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: A pointer to an object that provides more information about the referencing feature or information type.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Report for location
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The feature pertaining to a report
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Encodable only as a generic association in 3.0.0 datasets as it is an information->feature link. Example: reference to a controlled area which requires a report to be filed upon entry and departure

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Report to
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The organisation or place to which a report is sent.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The regulation, restriction, recommendation, or nautical information

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Service Hours (reference)
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Service hours for an authority ore service provider

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The service hours for a non-standard workday
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The usual service hours to which an exception applies

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Service place
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Pointer to service or facility
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Distinction: serviceArea (area served by a provider)

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Service area
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The area served by a service provider.
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Distinction: servicePlace (the facility for which contact information is provided)

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Service provider
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: Pointer to a feature from where a provider supplies a service.

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: The ship report
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The report to be filed by a vessel

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Traffic service report
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The report for a traffic service

S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:name: Vessel location
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:definition: The location to which the permission statement applies
S100FC:S100_FC_Role.S100FC:remarks: Implementations must use between Applicability and PermissionType objects, not to feature instance. The PermissionType->feature link is via a generic inverse association

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Additional information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association for the binding between at least one instance of a geo feature and an instance of an information type.
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: Role informationProvidedFor encodable only as a generic inverse association in feature objects in 3.0.0 datasets

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Associated RxN
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association between a geographic location and a regulation, restriction, recommendation, or nautical information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: Role appliesInLocation encodable only as a generic inverse association in 3.0.0 datasets as it is an information->feature link

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Exceptional workday
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Exception to the usual working day

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Inclusion type
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association class specifying the relationship between the subset of vessels described by an APPLIC data object and a regulation (restriction, recommendation, or nautical information).

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Permission type
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association class for associations describing whether the subsets of vessels determined by the ship characteristics specified in APPLIC may (or must, etc.) transit, enter, or use a feature.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Reporting authority
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: The authority with which a report must be filed

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Reporting requirement
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association between types of reports and classes of vessels which must file report of the type described

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Service contact
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Contact details for a service or facility

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Service control
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association between a geographically located service and the organisation that controls it
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: This is an information association linking a location where a service is provided with an information type describing the provider. Contrast to serviceProvisionArea, which is a feature association linking the area served with another feature describing the provider. Role controlledService encodable only as a generic inverse association in 3.0.0 datasets as it is an information->feature link

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Spatial Association
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: An association for the binding between a spatial type and its spatial quality information.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Location hours
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Working hours for a service or facility described by a geographic location
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: This association links a geo feature to a Service Hours object. Distinction: authyHours, which links an information type (Authority) to a Service Hours object.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:name: Traffic service report
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association between traffic control service and reports required of vessels pertaining to that area
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationAssociation.S100FC:remarks: Role reptForLocation encodable only as a generic inverse association in 3.0.0 datasets as it is an information->feature link

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Service provision area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: Association linking the location from which a service is provided and the area(s) served.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:remarks: This is a feature association linking a provider described by a geographic feature with the area served (another geographic feature). Contrast to srvControl, which is an information association linking the area served to an information object describing the provider.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Pilotage district association
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association for the binding between a pilotage district and its component pilot boarding places.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Text association
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association for the binding between a geo feature and the cartographically positioned location for text.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:name: Traffic control service aggregation
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureAssociation.S100FC:definition: A feature association for the binding between a traffic control service and auxiliary features.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Information Type
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Generalized information type which carries all the common attributes

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: AbstractRxN
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: An abstract superclass for information types that encode rules, recommendations, and general information in text or graphic form.
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:remarks: Subtypes of AbstractRxN carry the same attributes, but differ in the nature of information they encode. There are currently four such subtypes: Regulations, Restrictions, Recommendations, and NauticalInformation.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Applicability
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Describes the relationship between vessel characteristics and: (i) the applicability of an associated information object or feature to the vessel; or, (ii) the use of a facility, place, or service by the vessel; or, (iii) passage of the vessel through an area.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Authority
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: A person or organisation having political or administrative power and control.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Contact details
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: information on how to reach a person or organisation by postal, internet, telephone, telex and radio systems

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Nautical information
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Nautical information about a related area or facility.
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:remarks: The association ref and role are overloaded since the feature association to this object has the same name, but the informationType element distinguishes it. The info->feature association is not allowed in edition 3.0.0. As a result, the multiplicity of informationProvidedFor role must be 0 because an instance may be associated with either feature or information type.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Non-standard working day
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Days when many services are not available. Often days of festivity or recreation when normal working hours are limited, esp. a national or religious festival, etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Service Hours
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: The time when a service is available and known exceptions.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Ship Report
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Describes how a ship should report to a maritime authority, including when to report, what to report and whether the format conforms to the IMO standard.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Recommendations
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Recommendations for a related area or facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Regulations
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Regulations for a related area or facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:name: Restrictions
S100FC:S100_FC_InformationType.S100FC:definition: Restrictions for a related area or facility.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Feature Type
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Generalized feature type which carries all the common attributes

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Organisation contact area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A feature often associated with contact information for an organization that exercises a management role or offers a service in the location.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: It is not a requirement that every instance of the feature be associated with a management, reporting, or service organization.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Supervised area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A location which may be supervised by a responsible or controlling authority.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: It is not a requirement that every feature instance be associated with an authority. Note that having AbstractService as well as SupervisedArea allows the subclasses to link to CONDET both directly and via AUTORI, which may not be desirable because it gives encoders two ways to reach almost the same result.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Reportable Service Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A service feature generally involving one or more reports from the requester, including communications not strictly considered “reporting.”
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: It is not a requirement for every instance to require a report.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Caution area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Generally, an area where the mariner has to be made aware of circumstances influencing the safety of navigation.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Concentration of shipping hazard area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area where hazards, caused by concentrations of shipping, may occur. Hazards are risks to shipping, which stem from sources other than shoal water or obstructions.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: ISPS code security level
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The area to which an International Ship and Port Facility Security (ISPS) level applies. The ISPS Code is a comprehensive set of measures to enhance the security of ships and port facilities, developed in response to the perceived threats to ships and port facilities in the wake of the 9/11 attacks in the United States.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Local Port Service Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A service established to provide port information without interaction between the customer and the service provider. This information could be inter alia berthing information, availability of port services, shipping schedules, meteorological and hydrological data.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Military practice area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area within which naval, military or aerial exercises are carried out. Also called an 'exercise area'.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Pilot boarding place
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The meeting place to which the pilot comes out.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Pilot service
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The service provided by a person who directs the movements of a vessel through pilot waters, usually a person who has demonstrated extensive knowledge of channels, aids to navigation, dangers to navigation, etc., in a particular area and is licensed for that area.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: The name of this object may be the same as the Pilot District of the associated PILBOPs.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Pilotage district
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area within which a pilotage direction exists. Such directions are regulated by a competent harbour authority which dictates circumstances under which they apply.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Piracy risk area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area where there is a raised risk of piracy or armed robbery.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Place of refuge
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A place where a ship in need of assistance can take action to enable it to stabilize its condition and reduce the hazards to navigation, and to protect human life and the environment.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Radar range
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Indicates the coverage of a sea area by a radar surveillance station. Inside this area a vessel may request shore-based radar assistance, particularly in poor visibility.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: Many large ports have a radar surveillance system covering their approaches to provide guidance for vessels, particularly in poor visibility. The maximum range of the system forms an arc or series of overlapping arcs (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4).

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Radio calling-in point
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: On passing a radio callin-in point or crossing a defined line vessels are required to report on VHF to a Traffic Control Centre. The attribute 'orientation' (ORIENT) encodes the orientation of the traffic flow at that point.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: Radio calling-in points are established in certain busy waterways and port approaches to assist traffic control.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Restricted area navigational
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A specified area of land or water designated by an appropriate authority within which access or navigation is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions. A navigational restricted area is an area where the restrictions have a direct impact on the navigation of a vessel in the area.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Restricted area regulatory
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A specified area of land or water designated by an appropriate authority within which access or navigation is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions. A regulatory restricted area is an area where the restrictions have no direct impact on the navigation of a vessel in the area, but impact on the activities that can take place within the area.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Routeing measure
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area or line designating the limits or central line of a routeing measure (or part of a routeing measure). Routeing measures include traffic separation schemes, deep-water routes, two-way routes, archipelagic sea lanes, and fairway systems.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: (1) categoryOfNavigationLine permitted only if categoryOfRouteingMeasure is 4 (recommended route). (2) categoryOfTrafficSeparationScheme permitted only if categoryOfRouteingMeasure = 5 (traffic separation scheme)

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Ship Reporting Service Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A service established by a relevant authority consisting of one or more reporting points or lines at which ships are required to report their identity, course, speed and other data to the monitoring authority.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Signal Station Warning
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A warning signal station is a place on shore from which warning signals are made to ships at sea.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Signal Station Traffic
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A traffic signal station is a place on shore from which signals are made to regulate the movement of traffic.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: A signal station is a place on shore from which signals are made to ships at sea (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition).

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Underkeel clearance allowance area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area for which an authority has stated underkeel allowance requirements.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Underkeel clearance management area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area for which an authority permits use of dynamic underkeel clearance information or provides dynamic information related to underkeel clearances.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Vessel Traffic Service Area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The area of any service implemented by a relevant authority primarily designed to improve safety and efficiency of traffic flow and the protection of the environment. It may range from simple information messages, to extensive organisation of the traffic involving national or regional schemes.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Waterway area
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area in which uniform general information of the waterway exists.
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:remarks: The current (January 2018) definition is the same as Waterway Area (wtware) in the Inland ENC domain.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Data quality
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Abstract feature type for data quality meta-features.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Quality of temporal variation
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: Abstract type for meta-feature which can describe temporal variation.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Data coverage
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: A geographical area that describes the coverage and extent of spatial objects.

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Quality of Non-Bathymetric Data
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: An area within which a uniform assessment of the quality of the non-bathymetric data exists

S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:name: Text Placement
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureType.S100FC:definition: The Text Placement feature is used in association with the Feature Name attribute or a light description to optimise text positioning in ECDIS.
